casebody.data:
Peter Hand Brewing Company, Appellee, v. Michael H. Schmitz and Annie J. Schmitz, Appellants.Gen. No. 22,014.

(Not to be reported in full.)

Abstract of the. Decision.Appeal and error, § 1751*—when judgment affirmed for absence of bill of exceptions. Where the errors assigned on appeal relate wholly to matters .that can be made to appear only by bill of exceptions and the record does not contain one, a motion to affirm the judgment below will be granted.Appeal from the Superior Court of Cook county; the Hon. William Fenimore Cooper, Judge, presiding. Heard in the Branch Appellate Court at the October term, 1915.Affirmed.Opinion filed May 23, 1916.

Statement .of the Case.

Action by Peter Hand Brewing Company, a corporation, plaintiff, against Michael H. Schmitz and Annie J. Schmitz, defendants. From a judgment for plaintiff, defendants appeal.

J. H. G-eweke, for appellants.Mayer, Meyer, Austrian & Platt, for appellee.

See Illinois Notes Digest, Vols. XI to XV, and Cumulative Quarterly, same topic and section number.

 Mr. Justice Barnes

delivered the opinion of the court.
